alert.note: Alert for Dawson (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 20 at 10:10PM CDT until further notice by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nebraska... Platte River Near Darr affecting Dawson County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Platte River near Darr, affecting western and central Dawson County. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Flooding of the low lying land right along the river can be expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:00 PM CDT Tuesday was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.2 feet early Wednesday afternoon. The river is forecast to fall to just below flood stage Friday or Saturday, then rise again back into minor flood stage late in the weekend and continue into early next week. These rises are due to several rounds of heavy rainfall that have occurred upstream over portions of Colorado. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.7 feet on 07/09/2019. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
